item.title: EA ‚ÄòGuarantees‚Äô Battlefield 6 Will Run At 60FPS Or More On All Platforms
item.content:encoded:
Electronic Arts and Battlefield Studios‚Äîa team made up of four EA-owned studios‚Äîare focused on making sure the upcoming military shooter Battlefield 6 is extremely well-optimized, with the developers claiming the game will run on all consoles and platforms at 60FPS or more.

Last week, EA revealed Battlefield 6‚Äòs multiplayer in a big event in Los Angeles. A large group of journalists (myself included) and content creators were invited there and got to play over four hours of BF6. The game reminds me a lot of Battlefield 3 and Battlefield 4, and that‚Äôs not by accident. The team of studios working on the FPS is specifically trying to create a new Battlefield game that harkens back to those more grounded and contemporary military shooters that were both fan favorites. From what I‚Äôve played so far, they‚Äôve nailed it. And another thing that I can confirm EA and Battlefield Studios have nailed is the game‚Äôs performance, which ran perfectly during my preview. That‚Äôs not shocking considering how hard the devs are working to ensure Battlefield 6 runs well on all platforms.

As spotted by TweakTown, in a recent interview with Battlefield 6‚Äòs principal game designer Florian Le Biha during the LA event, YouTuber Tech & Co asked about the game‚Äôs performance and optimization and Le Biha confirmed that it will run at a minimum of 60FPS on all consoles and PC.

‚ÄúWell, optimization for us has been one of the most important things for [Battlefield 6],‚Äù said Le Biha. ‚ÄúWe want to make sure that it‚Äôs not just a game that looks graphically super beautiful, but it‚Äôs also a game that runs on all configurations, whether it‚Äôs on PC or on all Xbox or PS5 [consoles] of this generation. So we put a lot of effort into optimizing the game. We guarantee 60FPS on all experiences on consoles, [higher framerates] on PC, obviously, and even more on consoles [which support] performance mode, which allows you to go even higher.‚Äù

As further reported by TweakTown, a player who says they are involved in BF6‚Äòs extensive early access playtesting program, known as BFLabs, claims on Reddit that the upcoming milsim targets 80FPS in performance mode on PlayStation 5 and also suggested that the PS5 Pro version of the game will hit 120FPS. They also explained that the Xbox Series S doesn‚Äôt have a performance mode, but still hits 60FPS, which lines up with what Le Biha told Tech & Co.

I can personally confirm that when I played Battlefield 6 on PS5 at a party hosted by EA after the event, the game ran extremely well, looking like at least a stable and locked 60 FPS with no noticeable drops. On PC, when I played the game during the event, it ran at over 120FPS and felt buttery smooth. Of course, things could change when the game arrives in October or when people go hands-on later this month during BF6‚Äòs open beta. But it does indeed seem like the devs are focused on making sure BF6 is super well-optimized on all platforms, even the Xbox Series S.

item.title: EA Explains Why Fans Aren‚Äôt Getting The Sims 5
item.content:encoded:
Will global warming kill your Switch 2? Is EA really never going to make a sequel to The Sims 4? Why is Dynasty Warriors 3 objectively the best one in the series? These and more questions might get answered as we at Kotaku experiment with reviving our old Morning Checkpoint roundup series that used to run on the weekends. The idea is to briefly round up all the news and conversations that we might not otherwise have a chance to hit as individual breakout news stories but are otherwise worth knowing or fun to talk about, like the first Call of Duty developer union winning its first collective bargaining agreement. Here we go!

The Sims 5 wouldn‚Äôt be ‚Äòplayer friendly‚Äô

That‚Äôs what EA entertainment president Laura Miele (she‚Äôs been at the company almost 30 years) told Variety when explaining why the hit life sim franchise has gone more than a decade without a direct sequel. ‚ÄúWhat I wouldn‚Äôt want to have happen is you to have to start from day zero and start from scratch and give up all of the things that you have created, give up all of the content that you‚Äôve purchased over the years,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúWe put out over 85 content packs over the last 10 years on The Sims 4, and so resetting that is not player friendly and not a good idea for our community.‚Äù What fans are getting is a Sims movie with help from Barbie‚Äòs Margot Robbie. Which other EA franchises might get in on the current Hollywood gaming goldrush next? Miele currently has her eyes set on Apex Legends.

One sequel we are getting is Darksiders 4

Call of Duty testers win second Microsoft gaming union contract

Quality assurance devs at Call of Duty support studio Raven Software were the first Activision Blizzard staff to organize a union amid the 2021 workplace fallout, but then saw negotiations drag on for years as they accused the publisher of bad-faith bargaining tactics. Shannon Liao at Updater now reports that the Game Workers Alliance has finally ratified its contract, which among things ‚Äúguarantees a 10 percent wage increase over two years.‚Äù It‚Äôs the second team at a Microsoft-owned studio to do so, with ZeniMax staff ratifying a contract in June just weeks before they were hit with mass layoffs. ‚ÄúIf our unit of 19 people can do this, anybody can, as long as you‚Äôre committed to actually just doing the work and seeing it through to the end,‚Äù Erin Hall told Liao.

Global warming will make it harder to play Switch 2 outside

Tomorrow it‚Äôs going to basically be 100 degrees in Kyoto, Japan, where Nintendo is headquartered. After a July that was the hottest month on record ever for Japan, the country is continuing to blaze through temperature records. Nintendo recently took the opportunity to remind fans that playing the Switch 2 in temperatures above 95 degrees is, uh, not great. ‚ÄúWhen using a Nintendo Switch or Nintendo Switch 2 in a high-temperature environment, the device‚Äôs temperature may rise,‚Äù the company posted. ‚ÄúThis could potentially cause malfunctions, so please use it in a location between 5‚Äì35¬∞C.‚Äù This isn‚Äôt the first time the company has had to issue a warning like this. It did a summertime PSA for the original Switch back in 2022. Everything is going great, folks.

Dynasty Warriors is getting a super, secret remaster

Koei Tecmo indicated that a game in the Dynasty Warriors series is getting remastered (but not which game) in a new trailer celebrating the series‚Äô 25th anniversary. Dynasty Warriors Origins, the entry that came out earlier this year, is also getting more DLC, the company revealed. But longtime fans are more interested in which games from the franchise‚Äôs past will get modern updates. Dynasty Warriors 3, 4, and 5 are all top of mind for most, though a compilation of all three would probably be ideal. Hell, why not do the whole first six games?

Fight censorship, get free games

Over 1 million people claimed the FreedomToBuy bundle from GOG in its 48 hours of being available, the storefront reports. It included Postal 2, Agony, Fetish Locator Week One, and a bunch of even weirder stuff, ‚Äúbecause if a game is legal, you should be free to buy it.‚Äù The bundle was in response to the recent crackdown on NSFW games on Steam and itch.io due to payment processors.

Metroid Prime 4: Beyond isn‚Äôt getting delayed

The year is more than half over and we still don‚Äôt know when Metroid Prime 4 is coming out. Some fans feared the game could slip to 2026 after it was a no-show during a recent Nintendo Partner Direct. But the company recently announced it will be playable at the Fan Expo Canada near the end of August. A November release date is feeling more and more likely.

Happy 40th Birthday Rare

Someone on Reddit found a leaked Amazon listing for an 8bitdo Xbox controller commemorating the 40th anniversary of Rare, the studio best known for Donkey Kong Country, Banjo-Kazooie, and Sea of Thieves, among other iconic classics. It‚Äôs $90 and looks very nice. There‚Äôs also a vinyl soundtrack collection and Evercade cartridges for old Rare games.

  • Valve and Mastercard are feuding over who‚Äôs to blame for sex game censorship
  • A Bioshock remake was shelved and Bioshock 4 is in trouble
  • After 4 Hours With Battlefield 6 I‚Äôm Convinced It Has The Juice

item.title: The Internet Reacts To Critical Role‚Äôs Big Shakeup
item.content:encoded:
After 10 years, Critical Role‚Äòs fourth campaign will be the webseries‚Äô first without Matthew Mercer serving as game master. The actual play show (and, now, multimedia franchise) began in 2015, and since then Mercer has led all three campaigns, which you can listen to on the group‚Äôs YouTube channel. Campaign IV, however, will be led by Brennan Lee Mulligan, a frequent collaborator with the group and the dungeon master of another actual play series called Dimension 20. Mulligan‚Äôs years of experience and familiarity with Critical Role make him one of the most well-suited candidates to take the reins of a new campaign. Fans erupted into thunderous applause when Mulligan was brought on stage during the group‚Äôs Indianapolis live show over the weekend, but this is still a big change, and the Critical Role community has feelings on the matter.

Mulligan was broadly welcomed with open arms, but many Critical Role fans noted they were sad to see Mercer step down from the GM role, even if he will be a part of the campaign as a player. Fans were also taken aback by the announcement that Campaign IV will take place in a new setting, rather than returning to Exandria, the setting in which the first three campaigns took place. While diehards are mourning a fantasy setting they‚Äôve been invested in for a decade along with Mercer‚Äôs shift out of the GM‚Äôs chair, this likely will make Campaign IV a better entry point for newcomers, as they won‚Äôt have to catch up on years of lore to jump in and watch.

I'll watch, continue subscribing, etc. But would be lying if I didn't say it breaks my heart that Matt isn't GM'ing and some of the core cast isn't returning.

Others, however, were quick to point out that Mercer would finally get a break from running the series‚Äô campaigns, and could come back stronger and lead a future story.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been enormous fans of Brennan‚Äôs for many years now, and when it came to giving both Matthew Mercer and the world of Exandria a bit of a breather, Brennan felt like the perfect storyteller to take our community somewhere entirely new,‚Äù Critical Role CEO, co-founder, and cast member Travis Willingham told Variety. ‚ÄúCritical Role has always been about genuine connection through storytelling first and foremost, and as Brennan himself will tell you, he‚Äôs still played more TTRPGs away from a camera than in front of it. His passion and drive for worldbuilding is infectious, and it‚Äôs been an absolute joy to spark off him as we forge ahead.‚Äù

Mulligan posted a lengthy message about these new developments on social media, confirming he will still be working with Dimension 20 and improv comedy network Dropout, Does this man ever sleep?

It is a gift, an honor, and a privilege to set out on this epic adventure with my friends at Critical Role, and I am grateful beyond words for their friendship, their creative brilliance, and the chance to tell this new epic story with them!  And most of all, I am grateful to you reading this right now ‚Äì There was no world where I didn‚Äôt spend my life telling stories with my friends, but the world where I get to do it for a living only exists because of you.

To everybody who has supported the shows and projects I‚Äôve been lucky enough to be a part of, I owe you a debt of gratitude I‚Äôll never be able to repay, but it will be the joy of my lifetime trying to repay it anyway. 

From the bottom of my heart ‚Äì HELL YEAH!
